meanings.definition: Cruel and oppressive government or rule.
meanings.sent1: The people rebelled against the tyranny of the king.
meanings.sent2: The citizens lived in fear under the tyranny of the dictator.
meanings.sent3: The tyranny of the strict teacher made the students dread going to class.
meanings.sent4: The tyranny of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The tyranny of the bully made the school a hostile place for many.

meanings.definition: A nation under cruel and oppressive government.
meanings.sent1: The citizens longed for freedom from the tyranny of their country.
meanings.sent2: The history books documented the struggles of a nation under tyranny.
meanings.sent3: The tyranny of the rainy weather ruined the outdoor picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: The tyranny of time seemed to speed up during moments of joy.
meanings.sent5: The tyranny of poverty kept many families in a cycle of struggle.

meanings.sent1: The company's policies created a culture of tyranny in the workplace.
meanings.sent2: The tyranny of fear paralyzed the community from speaking out.
meanings.sent3: The tyranny of the alarm clock made waking up early unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The tyranny of addiction held a tight grip on the individual's life.
meanings.sent5: The tyranny of perfectionism prevented the artist from finishing any work.
